roots.name: Design Logic
roots.subtitle: THE MIND
roots.governs: How a work constructs, organizes, and assigns value through visible structure rather than content or narrative.
roots.function: Design Logic accounts for the way visual elements are calculated, arranged, and prioritized so that some things matter more than others. It describes how meaning is built, not what that meaning is. This root operates through selection, ordering, and emphasis.
accessConditions: RAP Evidence Gate passed
At least 2 distinct mechanisms support it
At least 1 alternative Root (e.g., R-A-H or K-S-F) explicitly considered
anchorCues: Clear hierarchy of forms or zones
Consistent internal logic across the surface
Visual prioritization (some elements dominate, others recede)
roots.overreachRisk: This Root is often invoked whenever a work feels coherent, even when no visible organizing logic is present. It is commonly used to legitimize interpretation after the fact.
roots.disproofTest: Is there visible structural logic organizing the work, or am I inferring coherence because I want it to be there?

adjacentRoots.name: The Eye
adjacentRoots.difference: The Eye governs where attention goes. Design Logic governs how elements are organized once seen.

adjacentRoots.name: Signal Strength
adjacentRoots.difference: Signal concerns attention capture. Design Logic concerns internal organization.

allowed: Hypotheses about constructed meaning, internal logic, valuation systems
notAllowed: Claims about intelligence, intent, symbolism, or message

roots.globalEcho: In Ixtli In Yollotl (Face & Heart). Intelligence cannot exist without Vitality.

roots.name: Tactile Execution
roots.subtitle: THE HAND
roots.governs: How a work is physically formed through contact, pressure, and resistance between tool, hand, and material.
roots.function: Tactile Execution accounts for visible acts of making. It describes how form emerges through friction, constraint, and physical manipulation rather than planning or concept. This root operates at the level of touch made visible.
accessConditions: RAP Evidence Gate passed
At least 2 distinct mechanisms support it
At least 1 alternative Root (e.g., Ch-M-R or A-M-N) explicitly considered
anchorCues: Evidence of pressure, drag, or resistance
roots.overreachRisk: This Root is often invoked whenever manual labor is visible, even when the marks do not meaningfully shape form or structure. It is commonly mistaken for proof of honesty or expressive truth.
roots.disproofTest: Do the visible marks actually shape form or structure, or are they merely decorative surface effects?

adjacentRoots.name: Hardware / Materiality
adjacentRoots.difference: Hardware concerns what the material is. The Hand concerns what is done to it.

adjacentRoots.name: Discipline
adjacentRoots.difference: Discipline reflects reliability over time. The Hand reflects immediate physical action.

allowed: Hypotheses about formation, resistance, and physical decision-making
notAllowed: Claims about authenticity, emotional honesty, or moral virtue

roots.globalEcho: Rasquachismo (Making do with broken materials) / Wabi-Sabi (The honest flaw).

roots.name: Structural Integrity
roots.subtitle: THE DISCIPLINE
roots.governs: How a work maintains reliability, consistency, and stability across its parts and over time.
roots.function: Structural Integrity accounts for trained control and repeatable decision-making. It describes whether choices hold together coherently rather than fluctuating or collapsing. This root operates through steadiness, not expressiveness.
accessConditions: RAP Evidence Gate passed
At least 2 distinct mechanisms support it
At least 1 alternative Root (e.g., Y-Tz-R or K-B-D) explicitly considered
anchorCues: Consistent handling of form or technique
roots.overreachRisk: This Root is often invoked as praise when a work merely avoids failure. Stability alone is mistaken for strength, even when the structure contributes little to perception.
roots.disproofTest: Are the decisions consistently applied, or do they break down under close inspection?

adjacentRoots.name: The Hand
adjacentRoots.difference: The Hand concerns physical action. Discipline concerns reliability across the whole.

adjacentRoots.name: The Anchor
adjacentRoots.difference: Discipline stabilizes internally. Anchor stabilizes visually or culturally.

allowed: Hypotheses about reliability, coherence, and trained control
notAllowed: Claims about seriousness, worth, or ethical superiority

roots.globalEcho: Itutu (Mystic Coolness). Maintaining grace under pressure; the discipline is hidden.

roots.name: Atmosphere
roots.subtitle: THE SPIRIT
roots.governs: How a work generates directional flow, motion, or connective energy that moves attention through space.
roots.function: Atmosphere accounts for invisible forces made perceptible through rhythm, circulation, and directional cues. It describes how elements activate space rather than sit statically. This root operates through movement without narrative.
accessConditions: RAP Evidence Gate passed
At least 2 distinct mechanisms support it
At least 1 alternative Root (e.g., R-A-H or K-S-F) explicitly considered
roots.overreachRisk: This Root is frequently inflated into metaphysical claims when movement or rhythm is merely suggested. Flow is assumed rather than demonstrated.
roots.disproofTest: Is there actual directional or rhythmic movement, or am I projecting vitality onto static elements?

adjacentRoots.name: The Eye
adjacentRoots.difference: The Eye directs focus. Atmosphere moves focus.

adjacentRoots.name: Signal Strength
adjacentRoots.difference: Signal grabs attention. Atmosphere sustains motion within it.

allowed: Hypotheses about movement, circulation, and spatial activation
notAllowed: Claims about spirit, emotion, transcendence, or intent

roots.name: Visual Hierarchy
roots.subtitle: THE EYE
roots.governs: How a work directs, orders, and sequences seeing through visible control of attention.
roots.function: Visual Hierarchy accounts for the movement from initial noticing to focused inspection. It describes how the eye is guided through the work via emphasis, contrast, and spatial ordering. This root operates before interpretation, at the level of seeing.
accessConditions: RAP Evidence Gate passed
At least 2 distinct mechanisms support it
At least 1 alternative Root (e.g., Ch-Sh-V or K-B-D) explicitly considered
anchorCues: Controlled viewing path or scan pattern
Depth cues that prioritize certain areas
Framing or cropping that directs attention
roots.overreachRisk: This Root is often invoked whenever a viewer notices something salient, even when the work provides no structured guidance for attention beyond novelty or habit.
roots.disproofTest: Is the eye actively guided by the work, or am I supplying my own viewing order?

adjacentRoots.name: Design Logic
adjacentRoots.difference: The Eye governs attention flow. Design Logic governs structural arrangement.

adjacentRoots.name: The Anchor
adjacentRoots.difference: Anchor creates weight. The Eye creates direction.

allowed: Hypotheses about attention control, sequencing, and emphasis
notAllowed: Claims about meaning, symbolism, or insight

roots.globalEcho: Ma (The Active Void). Seeing the space between objects as a solid thing.

roots.name: Narrative Sequence
roots.subtitle: THE NARRATIVE
roots.governs: How a work establishes temporal or causal order, implying progression, development, or outcome.
roots.function: Narrative Sequence accounts for sequencing across time. It describes how elements suggest a before, during, and after, or a problem moving toward resolution. This root operates through ordering, not depiction.
accessConditions: RAP Evidence Gate passed
At least 2 distinct mechanisms support it
At least 1 alternative Root (e.g., R-A-H or Ch-Sh-V) explicitly considered
roots.overreachRisk: This Root is often assumed whenever a recognizable subject appears. Narrative is projected even when no sequencing or causality is visually established.
roots.disproofTest: Is there clear visual sequencing or causality, or am I supplying the story myself?

adjacentRoots.name: Design Logic
adjacentRoots.difference: Design Logic structures relationships. Narrative structures time.

adjacentRoots.name: The Eye
adjacentRoots.difference: The Eye guides attention. Narrative implies progression.

allowed: Hypotheses about temporal order, progression, or causality
notAllowed: Claims about meaning, message, or artist intent

roots.globalEcho: Ayni (Sacred Reciprocity). The story isn't about 'winning' (resolution) but 'exchange' (balance).

roots.name: Signal Strength
roots.subtitle: THE ATTENTION ECONOMY
roots.governs: How a work captures and sustains attention through salience, contrast, and perceptual bidding.
roots.function: Signal Strength accounts for attention competition under scarcity. It describes how certain elements outcompete others for notice and retention. This root operates through prominence, not value.
accessConditions: RAP Evidence Gate passed
At least 2 distinct mechanisms support it
At least 1 alternative Root (e.g., K-B-D or R-W-Ch) explicitly considered
roots.overreachRisk: This Root is frequently mistaken for merit. High salience is treated as evidence of significance even when the attention captured leads nowhere.
roots.disproofTest: Does the work actively compete for attention, or does attention persist for other reasons?

adjacentRoots.name: The Anchor
adjacentRoots.difference: Signal captures attention. Anchor holds weight.

adjacentRoots.name: Atmosphere
adjacentRoots.difference: Signal arrests attention. Atmosphere circulates it.

allowed: Hypotheses about attention capture, retention, and salience
notAllowed: Claims about meaning, value, or importance

roots.globalEcho: Hózhó (Beauty/Harmony). The goal is not to 'grab' the eye (anxiety) but to 'restore' the eye (peace).

roots.name: Gravitas
roots.subtitle: THE ANCHOR
roots.governs: How a work establishes visual and contextual weight, creating stability, grounding, or perceived importance.
roots.function: Gravitas accounts for where weight settles in a composition or object. It describes how mass, density, or contextual signals cause elements to feel fixed, grounded, or consequential. This root operates through holding power, not attention capture.
accessConditions: RAP Evidence Gate passed
At least 2 distinct mechanisms support it
At least 1 alternative Root (e.g., K-S-F or T-H-W) explicitly considered
anchorCues: Bottom-weighting or low center of gravity
Dense or compact forms acting as weight wells
Contextual markers only when visually present (pedestal logic, framing weight, scale dominance)
roots.overreachRisk: This Root is often invoked through reputation or context rather than visible weight. Institutional status is mistaken for perceptual gravity even when the work itself carries little mass or stability.
roots.disproofTest: Is there visible weight or grounding, or am I borrowing gravity from context alone?

adjacentRoots.name: Signal Strength
adjacentRoots.difference: Signal captures attention. Gravitas holds it in place.

adjacentRoots.name: Noise
adjacentRoots.difference: Gravitas stabilizes perception. Noise destabilizes it.

allowed: Hypotheses about grounding, stability, and perceived weight
notAllowed: Claims about importance, value, or authority

roots.globalEcho: Ubuntu (Collective Lineage). The weight comes from the community connection, not the hierarchy.

roots.name: Entropy
roots.subtitle: THE NOISE
roots.governs: How a work loses clarity through interference, breakdown, or unintentional confusion.
roots.function: Entropy accounts for signal degradation. It describes how marks, forms, or structures interfere with one another so that perception stalls or collapses. This root operates through loss, not complexity.
accessConditions: RAP Evidence Gate passed
At least 2 distinct mechanisms support it
At least 1 alternative Root (e.g., Ch-Sh-V or K-S-F) explicitly considered
anchorCues: Signals that cancel or obscure one another
Ambiguity that repels attention rather than sustains it
roots.overreachRisk: This Root is often invoked as a critical dismissal when the viewer fails to engage. Difficulty is confused with breakdown even when structure or intention is present.
roots.disproofTest: Is perception actually obstructed, or am I mistaking challenge for failure?

adjacentRoots.name: Design Logic
adjacentRoots.difference: Design Logic structures coherence. Entropy erodes it.

adjacentRoots.name: Signal Strength
adjacentRoots.difference: Signal competes for attention. Entropy prevents it from stabilizing.

allowed: Hypotheses about interference, breakdown, or loss of clarity
notAllowed: Claims about intent, incompetence, or value

activators: Negative Activator (Violation of Principle #24 Value Structure)

roots.name: Materiality
roots.subtitle: THE HARDWARE
roots.governs: How a work exists as a physical object, defined by the properties and limits of its material.
roots.function: Materiality accounts for medium truth and object behavior. It describes how substance, viscosity, density, and resistance shape what can and cannot occur. This root operates through material constraint, not technique.
accessConditions: RAP Evidence Gate passed
At least 2 distinct mechanisms support it
At least 1 alternative Root (e.g., Y-Tz-R or K-L-Y) explicitly considered
anchorCues: Viscosity or fluid behavior of the medium
Evidence of material resistance or compliance
Object cues (thickness, edge profile, weight suggestion)
roots.overreachRisk: This Root is often romanticized as honesty or purity. Material presence is mistaken for ethical value even when the material contributes little to perception.
roots.disproofTest: Is the material actively shaping perception, or is it merely present?

adjacentRoots.name: The Hand
adjacentRoots.difference: The Hand concerns action. Materiality concerns substance.

adjacentRoots.name: The Vessel
adjacentRoots.difference: Materiality defines substance. The Vessel defines format.

allowed: Hypotheses about substance, constraint, and object behavior
notAllowed: Claims about authenticity, honesty, or value

roots.name: Format
roots.subtitle: THE VESSEL
roots.governs: How a work's container, scale, and format constrain and shape what can occur within it.
roots.function: Format accounts for capacity and fit. It describes how size, proportions, and structural boundaries enable or restrict action, perception, and meaning. This root operates through containment, not surface appearance.
accessConditions: RAP Evidence Gate passed
At least 2 distinct mechanisms support it
At least 1 alternative Root (e.g., Ch-M-R or K-B-D) explicitly considered
anchorCues: Scale mismatches between content and container
Format used as an active tool
Panel, page, or object logic shaping decisions
Genre or platform constraints when structurally visible
roots.overreachRisk: This Root is often flattened into surface description. Format is treated as neutral even when it actively limits or distorts what the work can support.
roots.disproofTest: Is the format actively shaping outcomes, or is it merely housing the work?

adjacentRoots.name: Materiality
adjacentRoots.difference: Materiality concerns substance. Format concerns containment.

adjacentRoots.name: Gravitas
adjacentRoots.difference: Format constrains space. Gravitas weights it.

allowed: Hypotheses about constraint, capacity, and fit
notAllowed: Claims about style, taste, or value
